alert.note: Alert for Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 3:49PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Washington, Pleasants, central Ritchie and northeastern Wood Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 349 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Boaz, or near Parkersburg, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Parkersburg, Marietta, Belpre, Harrisville, St. Marys, Vienna, Williamstown, Belmont, North Bend State Park, Boaz, Newport, North Hills, Ellenboro, Cairo, Willow Island, Nutter Farm, Maxwell, Petroleum, Schultz and Waverly. This includes the following highways... Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 172 and 186. Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 5 and 39. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
